questions.question_text:
An administrator is tasked with creating cloud zones for an existing Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud account.
Which type of compute resource can be added to the cloud zone?

discussion.content:
C
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Assembly/services/Using-and-Managing/GUID-DDAA67C6-EC17-41BD-BF15-98EEF9B0A418.html
Correct answer C!
C looks correct.
Answer is definitely C.
It's C, you can choose the availability zone for the Regions.
I guess that is C as well

comments.content:
Computes
You can view and manage the compute resources that are available to provision workloads, such as AWS availability zones and vCenter clusters, to this cloud zone.

discussion.content:
I believe answer is C - Availability Zones. Question asks what Compute Type and Cloud Zone's are mapped to AZs. 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Assembly/services/Using-and-Managing/GUID-9E6FE02D-2519-4C5B-85BD-2330B8421D73.html#GUID-9E6FE02D-2519-4C5B-85BD-2330B8421D73

correct answer is B
question is saying "which type of compute....." compute in AWS is EC2
Correct

questions.question_text:
The vRealize Orchestrator Service runs as a Kubernetes pod within each vRealize Automation appliance.
Which two containers make up the vRealize Orchestrator Service? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Storing of events in the database

discussion.content:
B is correct, 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Orchestrator/8.1/com.vmware.vrealize.orchestrator-install-config.doc/GUID-4E29EBE7-181D-4B17-982E-7599F9164F1B.html
B is correct
